labels.analysis: The HDW MCP Server is primarily designed to interact with LinkedIn's platform through an extensive API toolkit. It allows users to search for and retrieve profile information, access user posts and messages, manage connections, and perform various actions like sending messages, posting content, and engaging with comments/reactions. The server also integrates Google search functionality for finding LinkedIn companies. The core functionality revolves around LinkedIn data access and management, with tools that facilitate both data retrieval and active interaction with the platform.
labels.reasoning:
The primary label is "Social Media" because the server's main focus is on LinkedIn, which is a social media platform, and it provides tools for interacting with user profiles, posts, messages, and other social features. The secondary label "Web Search & Research" is included due to the presence of Google search integration for finding LinkedIn companies. The secondary label "Communication Tools" is also relevant as the server allows users to send messages and manage conversations on LinkedIn.

    There is no need for a custom label as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: HDW MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @horizondatawave/hdw-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Access LinkedIn data and manage user accounts seamlessly. Retrieve profiles, search users, and interact with posts and messages through a powerful API. Enhance your applications with comprehensive LinkedIn functionalities.

tools.name: search_linkedin_users
tools.description: Deploy Server HDW MCP Server Claim Server @horizondatawave/hdw-mcp-server Try in Playground search_linkedin_users

tools.name: get_linkedin_profile
tools.description: Get detailed information about a LinkedIn user profile

tools.name: get_linkedin_email_user
tools.description: Get LinkedIn user details by email

tools.name: get_linkedin_user_posts
tools.description: Get LinkedIn posts for a user by URN (must include prefix, example: fsd_profile:ACoAAEWn01QBWENVMWqyM3BHfa1A-xsvxjdaXsY)

tools.name: get_linkedin_user_reactions
tools.description: Get LinkedIn reactions for a user by URN (must include prefix, example: fsd_profile:ACoAA...)

tools.name: get_linkedin_chat_messages
tools.description: Get top chat messages from LinkedIn management API. Account ID is taken from environment.

tools.name: send_linkedin_chat_message
tools.description: Send a chat message via LinkedIn management API. Account ID is taken from environment.

tools.name: send_linkedin_connection
tools.description: Send a connection invitation to LinkedIn user. Account ID is taken from environment.

tools.name: send_linkedin_post_comment
tools.description: Create a comment on a LinkedIn post or on another comment. Account ID is taken from environment.

tools.name: get_linkedin_user_connections
tools.description: Get list of LinkedIn user connections. Account ID is taken from environment.

tools.name: get_linkedin_post_reposts
tools.description: Get LinkedIn reposts for a post by URN

tools.name: get_linkedin_post_comments
tools.description: Get LinkedIn comments for a post by URN

tools.name: get_linkedin_google_company
tools.description: Search for LinkedIn companies using Google search. First result is usually the best match.

tools.name: get_linkedin_company
tools.description: Get detailed information about a LinkedIn company

tools.name: get_linkedin_company_employees
tools.description: Get employees of a LinkedIn company

tools.name: send_linkedin_post
tools.description: Create a post on LinkedIn. Account ID is taken from environment.

tools.name: linkedin_sn_search_users
tools.description: Advanced search for LinkedIn users using Sales Navigator filters

tools.name: get_linkedin_conversations
tools.description: Get list of LinkedIn conversations from the messaging interface. Account ID is taken from environment.

tools.name: google_search
tools.description: Search for information using Google search API

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@horizondatawave/hdw-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: hdwAccessToken
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Your Horizon Data Wave access token
